    • Field Detail

      • reportSum

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> reportSum
        We'll use these to create a summary line at the end of the report. The key to each map is the fieldName. Non-null values will be added to the value in the key/value pairs. Averages will be calculated from the sum and the count. "Count Distinct" will be the number of entries in the List<String>

      • reportCount

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> reportCount

      • reportCountDistinct

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> reportCountDistinct

      • previousValues

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> previousValues
        We'll use these to create subtotal lines. As each line is added, the values will be checked against "previousValue". If the value has changed and there's a subtotal trigger, a subtotal line will be added and the subtotal counters will be cleared;

      • subtotalSum

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> subtotalSum

      • subtotalCount

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> subtotalCount

        protected org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger

      • getReport

        public AbstractReport getReport()

      • formatValue

        @Deprecated
protected java.lang.String formatValue​(DataFormats dataFormat,
                                       java.lang.Object value)
                                throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                       java.lang.SecurityException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                       java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Deprecated.
        Use ReportUtils.makeHeaderRowCount()
        Figure out how many rows of titles and/or header data we have. There is always at least a single row for the banner. Count is incremented for title and subtitle, and for each row of header data (right/left columns) beyond the banner/title/subtitle.
        Returns:
        Number of rows in the header
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException
        java.lang.SecurityException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

      • initializeSummaries

        protected void initializeSummaries​(ColumnHeader[] headerRow)
        The summary data needs to be initialized to zeros before starting. Else we've got to null check on every value, and I don't want to do that. This method is called by the constructor
        Parameters:
        headerRow - The list of columns in the report.

      • doSummaries

        protected void doSummaries​(ColumnHeader columnHeader,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        Every time a row is added to the report, add the non-null values to the summary trackers. We only do this for fields that will be in the summary row.
        Parameters:
        columnHeader - Build summary values
        value - The value to be added to the summary

      • makeSummaryData

        protected java.lang.String makeSummaryData​(ColumnHeader columnHeader)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        We've reached the end of the report and need to add a summary row. For each column header where summary type is not "NONE", call this method to get/format the data from the summary trackers. Averages and sums are formatted in the same way as the data. Counts are formatted as pretty integers.
        Parameters:
        columnHeader - Which column are we building a summary for
        Returns:
        The formatted summary data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Something bad happened

      • makeSubtotalData

        protected java.lang.String makeSubtotalData​(ColumnHeader columnHeader)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • makeDisplayData

        protected java.lang.Object makeDisplayData​(ColumnHeader columnHeader,
                                           java.lang.Object row)
                                    throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                           java.lang.SecurityException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                           java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Get the data from an arbitrary row object
        Parameters:
        columnHeader - Which column of the report are we building
        row - The row data object which contains the data to be displayed
        Returns:
        The data to be displayed
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - The method in the formatter is wrong
        java.lang.SecurityException - java reflection error - this shouldn't happen
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - java reflection error - this shouldn't happen
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Mismatch in the getter's parameters (there are no parms, so this shouldn't happen either)
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - java reflection error - this shouldn't happen

      • makeFormattedDisplayData

        protected java.lang.String makeFormattedDisplayData​(DataFormats dataFormats,
                                                    java.lang.Object value)
                                             throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                    java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                    java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                    java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Format the data according to the standard method specified.
        Parameters:
        dataFormats - How to format the value
        value - the data to be formatted
        Returns:
        Formatted data
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - The formatter has an invalid formatting method name
        java.lang.SecurityException - java reflection error - this shouldn't happen
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException - java reflection error - this shouldn't happen
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The formatting method has a mismatch in the expected arguments
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - java reflection error - this shouldn't happen
